Overview[]: Luke is a fatigued survivor who understands there is safety in numbers. He values what is beautiful and hopeful and makes people uniquely human. He’s more on the artist’s spectrum of personality, preaching the love of music as a necessity to maintain humanity during chaotic times. Among his group, he is the most jovial and friendly. As he and his group are interviewed, he is shown to be quite humble, believing he's not sure what he did to deserve to still be alive, saying he just got lucky. He acts as a voice of reason for the group, convincing Magna to not attack Alexandria , reasoning that they have kids. As a music teacher, Luke is shown to be very knowledgeable and intelligent. He cherishes his instruments and the history behind them, something his group often teases him about. At one point, Michonne sees Luke holding something and believes it to be a weapon. However, it's actually revealed to be a Stradivarius, which Michonne slices in half, something Luke becomes distraught over. Luke quickly forgives Michonne for this act. Unlike many who have become hardened survivors, Luke is very upbeat and optimistic, something quite rare this far into the apocalypse. As his group discusses whether they should join Michonne's group or take their chances on their own, Luke is the most vocal on joining believing in strength in numbers. Luke quickly becomes an accepted member of the group, volunteering to join a search party. Luke is very humorous, personable, and witty when interacting with others. He forms a friendship with Alden with the two bonding over music. Later, Luke manages to convince Alden to sing at the fair. In Season 10 , Luke becomes a member of the Coalition , helping whenever he is needed. He develops feelings for Jules , an Oceanside resident. He greatly care for her well-being, joining Michonne on her trip to Oceanside to see if she's okay after Whisperer activity is spotted. He still retains his optimistic nature, defending Virgil , since he had saved his life earlier and has photos of his family. Though Luke generally is shown to not be the most combat-proficient, Luke's intelligence helps take out Alpha 's mega herd . Using music to lure the walkers off a cliff, his plan ends up being successful.
Pre-Apocalypse[]: Nothing is known about Luke's life prior to or as the outbreak began, except that he was a music teacher and had some culinary experience. He also enjoyed spending time at the library.
Post-Apocalypse[]: At some point after the outbreak, Luke met girlfriends Magna and Yumiko , siblings Connie and Kelly , Bernie among other survivors. The group survived for several years, eventually becoming closer and seeing each other as family. However, as the years went by, several members of the group died. The group resided in different communities, such as Jones Springs and Coalport , both which eventually fell causing the group's distrust in rejoining any other similar settlements.
Death[]: Killed By Pamela Milton (Caused) Livits (Caused) Zombies (Caused, Alive) Kelly (Alive, Accidental) Connie (Alive, Accidental) Yumiko Okumura (Alive, Accidental) During the Battle for the Commonwealth, Luke is bitten on the leg and dies of blood loss following a failed attempt at saving his life with amputation performed by Magna, Yumiko, Kelly, and Connie. Magna (Alive, Accidental; Before Reanimation) After Luke dies, Magna sadly stabs her friend in the head to prevent reanimation.
Killed Victims[]: This list shows the victims Luke has killed: At least 13 unnamed Whisperers (1 Direct, 12 Alongside Daryl , Carol , Jerry , Magna , Lydia , Kelly , Marco , and Jules ) Numerous counts of zombies
Relationships[]: For a more in-depth look at Luke's relationships, read here: Luke Abrams (TV Series)/Relationships
Gallery[]: For more images of Luke, please visit Luke Abrams (TV Series)/Gallery .
Trivia[]: Luke is the only male member of Magna's group seen alive on-screen because Kelly , unlike her comic counterpart , is a female and Bernie died off-screen and was only seen as a zombie. Luke is the only member of Magna's group to die on-screen. He is also the last member of Magna's group to die. Luke is the only member of Magna's group seen alive who did not become a main character. Luke is one of eight characters who know ASL, the others being his fellow group members Magna , Yumiko Okumura , Kelly , and Connie , as well as Carol Peletier , Daryl Dixon , and Gabriel Stokes . Luke is the sixth supporting character to outlive his comic book counterpart, with the first being Ed Peletier , the second being Scott , the third being Tobin , the fourth being Kal , and the fifth being Bruce . Luke is noticeably absent from the majority of Season 11 . This is due to Dan Fogler 's filming commitments to Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore . Luke is one of the fourteen TV Series characters whose comic counterparts lack a known last name. The others being Amy Harrison , Andrea Harrison , Dale Horvath , Carol Peletier , Sophia Peletier , Tyreese Williams , Eric Raleigh , Negan Smith , Lucille Smith , Ezekiel Sutton , Yumiko Okumura , Maxxine Mercer , and Kayla Brand . Luke and Jules are the last characters to have their last names revealed in the TV Series . Luke is the last character to receive an amputation. He is the second character to die from blood lost after receiving an amputation, with the first being Tyreese Williams .
